title: Authors and Citation
text: Lv W (2024). gdverse: Geographic detector models. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://spatlyu.github.io/gdverse/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gdverse: Geographic detector models},   author = {Wenbo Lv},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://spatlyu.github.io/gdverse/}, }

title: ecological detector — ecological_detector
text: Compare effects two factors \(X_1\) \(X_2\) spatial distribution attribute \(Y\).

title: ecological detector — ecological_detector
text: y Dependent variable, continuous numeric vector. x1 Covariate \(X_1\), factor, character discrete numeric. x2 Covariate \(X_2\), factor, character discrete numeric. alpha (optional) Confidence level interval,default 0.95.

title: ecological detector — ecological_detector
text: list contains F statistics, p-values, significant difference two factors \(X_1\) \(X_2\) spatial distribution attribute \(Y\)

title: factor detector — factor_detector
text: factor detector q-statistic measures spatial stratified heterogeneity variable Y, determinant power covariate X Y.

title: factor detector — factor_detector
text: y Variable Y, continuous numeric vector. x Covariate X, factor, character discrete numeric.

title: geographical detector model — gd
text: formula formula geographical detector model. data data.frame tibble observation data. type (optional) type geographical detector,must one factor(default), interaction, risk, ecological. ... (optional) Specifies size alpha (confidence level).Default 0.95.

title: geographical detector model — gd
text: tibble corresponding result stored corresponding detector type.

title: geographical detector model — gd
code: gd(y ~ x1 + x2,    tibble::tibble(y = 1:7,                   x1 = c('x',rep('y',3),rep('z',3)),                   x2 = c(rep('a',2),rep('b',2),rep('c',3)))) #> $factor #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   variable `Q-statistic` `P-value` #>   <chr>            <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 x2               0.893    0.0317 #> 2 x1               0.771    0.0794 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "factor_detector"  gd(y ~ x1 + x2,    tibble::tibble(y = 1:7,                   x1 = c('x',rep('y',3),rep('z',3)),                   x2 = c(rep('a',2),rep('b',2),rep('c',3))),    type = 'interaction') #> $interaction #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   variable1 variable2 Interaction  Variable1 Q-statisti…¹ Variable2 Q-statisti…² #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>                         <dbl>                  <dbl> #> 1 x1        x2        Weaken, non…                  0.771                  0.893 #> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​`Variable1 Q-statistics`, ²​`Variable2 Q-statistics` #> # ℹ 1 more variable: `Variable1 and Variable2 interact Q-statistics` <dbl> #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "interaction_detector"  gd(y ~ x1 + x2,    tibble::tibble(y = 1:7,                   x1 = c('x',rep('y',3),rep('z',3)),                   x2 = c(rep('a',2),rep('b',2),rep('c',3))),    type = 'risk',alpha = 0.95) #> $risk #> # A tibble: 12 × 7 #>    variable zone1 zone2 Risk  `T-statistic` `Degree-freedom` `P-value` #>    <chr>    <chr> <chr> <fct>         <dbl>            <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 x1       x     y     No             0                0       1      #>  2 x1       x     z     No             0                0       1      #>  3 x1       y     x     No             0                0       1      #>  4 x1       y     z     Yes           -3.67             4       0.0213 #>  5 x1       z     x     No             0                0       1      #>  6 x1       z     y     Yes            3.67             4       0.0213 #>  7 x2       a     b     No            -2.83             2       0.106  #>  8 x2       a     c     Yes           -5.89             2.88    0.0109 #>  9 x2       b     a     No             2.83             2       0.106  #> 10 x2       b     c     Yes           -3.27             2.88    0.0494 #> 11 x2       c     a     Yes            5.89             2.88    0.0109 #> 12 x2       c     b     Yes            3.27             2.88    0.0494 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "risk_detector"  gd(y ~ x1 + x2,    tibble::tibble(y = 1:7,                   x1 = c('x',rep('y',3),rep('z',3)),                   x2 = c(rep('a',2),rep('b',2),rep('c',3))),    type = 'ecological',alpha = 0.95) #> $ecological #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   variable1 variable2 Ecological `F-statistic` `P-value` #>   <chr>     <chr>     <fct>              <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 x1        x2        No                  2.13     0.189 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "ecological_detector"

title: interaction detector — interaction_detector
text: Identify interaction different risk factors, , assess whether factors X1 X2 together increase decrease explanatory power dependent variable Y, whether effects factors Y independent .

title: interaction detector — interaction_detector
text: y Dependent variable, continuous numeric vector. x1 Covariate \(X_1\), factor, character discrete numeric. x2 Covariate \(X_2\), factor, character discrete numeric.

title: interaction detector — interaction_detector
text: list contains Q statistic factors \(X_1\) \(X_1\) act \(Y\) alone Q statistic two interact \(Y\) together result type interaction detector.

title: print ecological detector — print.ecological_detector
text: S3 method format output ecological detector gd().

title: print factor detector — print.factor_detector
text: S3 method format output factor detector gd().

title: print interaction detector — print.interaction_detector
text: S3 method format output interaction detector gd().

title: print risk detector — print.risk_detector
text: S3 method format output risk detector gd().

title: risk detector — risk_detector
text: Determine whether significant difference attribute means two subregions.

title: risk detector — risk_detector
text: y Variable Y, continuous numeric vector. x Covariate X, factor, character discrete numeric. alpha (optional) Confidence level interval,default 0.95.

title: risk detector — risk_detector
text: tibble contains different combinations covariate X level student t-test statistics, degrees freedom, p-values, whether risk (Yes ).
